articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: China's imports and exports fell much faster than expected in July as weaker demand threatens recovery prospects in the world's second-largest economy, heightening pressure for authorities to release fresh stimulus to steady growth.
articles.title: China's trade slumps, threatening recovery prospects

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) said on Tuesday its obesity drug Wegovy reduced the risk of a major cardiovascular event like a stroke by 20% in overweight or obese people with a history of heart disease, exceeding expectations from a key late-stage trial.
articles.title: Novo's weight-loss drug Wegovy cuts risk of heart disease by 20% - trial data

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Federico Maccioni, Giuseppe Fonte
articles.description: Italy has approved a one-off 40% tax on profits banks reap from higher interest rates and it plans to use proceeds to help mortgage holders, in a move that sent banking shares plunging.
articles.title: Italy approves 40% windfall tax on banks for 2023

articles.author: Lananh Nguyen, Juby Babu
articles.description: Moody's cut credit ratings of several small to mid-sized U.S. banks on Monday and said it may downgrade some of the nation's biggest lenders, warning that the sector's credit strength will likely be tested by funding risks and weaker profitability.
articles.title: Moody's downgrades US banks, warns of possible cuts to others

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Movie theater chain AMC Entertainment Holdings (AMC.N) said the current quarter was off to a strong start driven by box-office hits such as "Barbie" and "Oppenheimer", after beating second-quarter revenue estimates on Tuesday.
articles.title: AMC sees 'explosive start' to third quarter on 'Barbenheimer' frenzy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Eli Lilly (LLY.N) beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit and raised its full-year earnings forecast on Tuesday, buoyed by strong demand for its new diabetes drugs Mounjaro, ahead of a decision on its use as a weight-loss treatment.
articles.title: Eli Lilly beats profit estimates on strength of new diabetes drug

articles.author: Raphael Satter, Zeba Siddiqui
articles.description: A hydra-headed breach centered on a single American software maker has compromised data at about 600 organizations worldwide, according to cyber analyst tallies corroborated by Reuters.
articles.title: Analysis: MOVEit hack spawned around 600 breaches but isn't done yet - cyber analysts

articles.author: Rod Nickel
articles.description: When Canadian dairy farmer Ben Loewith's calves are born next spring, they will be among the first in the world to be bred with a specific environmental goal: burping less methane.
articles.title: The climate-friendly cows bred to belch less methane

articles.author: Dawn Chmielewski, Krystal Hu
articles.description: Walt Disney (DIS.N) has created a task force to study artificial intelligence and how it can be applied across the entertainment conglomerate, even as Hollywood writers and actors battle to limit the industry's exploitation of the technology.
articles.title: Disney creates task force to explore AI and cut costs - sources

articles.author: Henriette Chacar, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich has frozen funds for Arab towns and Palestinian education programmes in East Jerusalem, citing crime and safety fears and prompting accusations of racism.
articles.title: Israeli finance minister suspends funds to Arab towns, East Jerusalem
